ygData.subject: Re: [rest-discuss] Work-arounds for RESTful use of unsupported PUT and DELETE?
ygData.msgSnippet: For what it is worth, the allmydata.org Tahoe project just faced this same issue, and we worked-around it by creating forms that do POSTs with query arguments

Subject: Re: [rest-discuss] Work-arounds for RESTful use of unsupported PUT and DELETE?
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=64125626; y=AQsXZU9Ftqu5MF-qnNjF7IJmlWo_fyhgAiTtzutbK-etRg

For what it is worth, the allmydata.org Tahoe project just faced this  
same issue, and we worked-around it by creating forms that do POSTs  
with query arguments explaining what we really meant, in addition to  
supporting PUT and DELETE:

http://allmydata.org/trac/tahoe/browser/docs/webapi.txt

The forms and POSTs work in a standard web browser even without  
JavaScript.  Presumably people using this API in a program will tend  
to use the actual PUT and DELETE.

Regards,

Zooko
